sentence.Network_en: They slowly moved from upstage left into the centre.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们慢慢地从舞台后方的左侧移至正中。

sentence.Network_cn: 他在会议期间尽力显得比上司突出.

entry.tran: 在舞台后部；朝舞台后面
entry.def: When an actor is upstage or moves upstage, he or she is or moves towards the back part of the stage.

example.ex: Upstage and right of centre, Robert Morris stands with his back to the audience...
example.tran: 舞台后方偏右处，罗伯特·莫里斯背对观众站着。
在舞台后面安置一部摄影机。

entry.def: If someone upstages you, they draw attention away from you by being more attractive or interesting.

example.ex: He had a younger brother who always publicly upstaged him...
example.tran: 他有一个弟弟，总是公然抢他的风头。

example.ex: He upstages her by flirting with other women.
example.tran: 他与其他女人调情，故意怠慢她。

means.word_mean: 1. treat snobbishly, put in one's place
2. move (another actor) upstage, forcing him to turn away from the audience
3. steal the show, draw attention to oneself away from someone else;

sentences.sentence: "When the dog entered the stage, he upstaged the actress"

means.word_mean: 1. of the back half of a stage;

sentences.sentence: "she crossed to the upstage chair forcing the lead to turn his back to the audience"

means.word_mean: 1. at or toward the rear of the stage;

sentences.sentence: "the dancers were directed to move upstage"

means.word_mean: 向舞台后部；在舞台后部

sentences.en: The actor moved upstage away from the audience.
sentences.cn: 演员移向舞台后部, 离观众越来越远。

sentences.en: He tried to upstage his boss at the meeting.
